name: Kentucky Cabinet for Health and Family Services
description: The Kentucky Cabinet for Health and Family Services (CHFS) is the state government agency responsible for administering health care, family support, and social services programs throughout Kentucky. The cabinet oversees Medicaid, SNAP benefits, child protective services, family assistance programs, and various other health and human services. They provide assistance with health care coverage, food assistance, child support, and family services through multiple departments and local offices statewide.
source: Verified from official Kentucky government websites and directories
eligibility: Kentucky residents in need of health and family services
notes: Main state agency for health and family services. Additional contact numbers: Main office (502) 564-5497, Toll-free (833) 372-0004, Family Support (855) 806-8959. Administers Medicaid, SNAP, child protective services, and family assistance programs. Local offices available throughout Kentucky.
